runs.comm: short of a length, on middle and leg, seaming away a touch, edged away past second slip. And Finn has fallen over in his follow through. Hope he doesn't kick the stumps
short of a length, pitched outside leg, 144ks, beats him for the pace, hits him on the thigh
this is dug in short, and Pathan has pulled this well, all along the ground, rolling the wrists on it, wide of deep square
appeal for lbw, but with this ball hitting middle and leg and not swinging, it had to pitch outside leg. Aleem Dar thinks the same
posthumous swing there. Short of a length, just outside leg, and swings away big time after passing Gambhir's hip. Kieswetter does well to collect it with a dive
dug in short again, Gambhir is in the air to try to work it away, is hit on the thigh, and Pathan calls him through for a leg-bye, even though the ball has gone about six feet from the stumps
huge lbw shout. This is bowled really full, and Pathan is playing across the line. However, Dar again thinks it is pitched outside leg
short and wide, that's a four ball, but Gambhir misses out on the quick
short of a length, on the pads, pushed to square leg inside the circle
that's a bit of rubbish. Short, gentle pace, pitched outside leg, and it bounces just waist high. Gambhir pulls it away between square leg and midwicket
that's a nice shot. Length ball, outside off, Gambhir follows it, opens the face, and times it superbly, placing it to the right of point and left of third man
short of a length, outside leg, Gambhir gets a leg-bye around the corner
slower ball at 109ks, and another appeal against Pathan, but he seems to have got a bit of an inside edge on this. Otherwise it pitched within the stumps, and was going on to hit
bouncer, 144ks, too high, and called a wide
pulled this time, in front of square, and mistimed too, but Pathan gets a single to mid-on
short of a length, outside off, dabbed away for a single
nice upper-cut. Finn bowls short again, provides him width, and Pathan gets under it, and sends it over point. Are England getting carried away with the short ball? This is not England, mind you
slower ball gone horribly wrong, a big wide down leg side

Finn has made the necessary correction. Bowls full and hits timber. Slightly fuller than a length ball, on off, holding its line slightly, Pathan has driven all around it, and he and his off stump have gone for a walk. That certainly seems back a little to hold its line against the angle
good welcome from Finn. Short of a length, on middle and off, seaming away a touch, and Kohli is right behind it
can this man do anything wrong? He has just defended a peach, but as soon as he gets width on alength ball, he drives it between cover and cover-point. Seems he could do it in his sleep
short of a length, middle and leg, worked away towards deep square
Kohli is on. Definitely on. Short of a length, outside off, and he has punched it away square for a four
gets a much easier ball this time, a half-volley, but finds short extra cover with it
good come back from Broad. Short of a length, outside off, seaming away, Kohli follows it, and is beaten
slightly fuller, slightly slower, steered away to third man
short of a length, outside off, plays the dab, but can't beat point
short of a length, just outside off, defended to cover
nice bounce from just short of a length, rising towards the chest, Kohli stands tall, opens the face, gets a single
short of a length, just outside off, and they drop and run before Morgan can swoop in
Kohli charges down, and doesn't care what is bowled at him. Bresnan bowls short, gets it chest high, but Kohli still upper-cuts it over point
length ball, wide outside off, Kohli doesn't move his feet, but times it well still. However, he has found the cover with this one
dabbed away square of third man, but not square enough to come back for two
Slips don't matter when you are in this form. Finn gives him a half-volley outside off, and he wristily drives it between Finn and mid-on
short of a length, just outside off, pushed to cover-point
short of a length, into the pads, worked away to deep square
Gambhir gets into the act now. Dances down the wicket, and makes room too before crashing this shortish delivery between cover and cover-point
dabs this one past point for a single
short of a length, on the stumps, nicely guided to third man
full, fast, on the pad, worked away for a single
Gambhir is down the wicket right away, and chips him to long-off for one
short of a length, on of,f doesn't turn, and Kohli does well to get an inside edge onto the pad
down the track, right down to the pitch, works it away for one
fired down the leg side, and is a wide
slower now, but no turn still, punched away to deep midwicket
full, on off, driven to long-on for one
full, outside off, driven to sweeper-cover
bouncer, pulled away crunchily, doesn't keep it down, but it bounces short of deep midwicket
it seemed Broad had done him in by following a backing-away Kohli, but he still manages to whip it over midwicket. One of these days, Kohli will actually mistime a shot
a massive grunt from Kohli as he misses out on a short and a wide delivery. No feet there
short of a length, outside off, steered away to third man
short of a length, on the stumps, runs it down to third man for one
gets too close to the pitch of the ball as he dances down, but manages to chip it well short of long-off for one
sharp turn, from short of a length and just outside off. For once, Kohli is cramped, and can't get it away
too short, pulled away to deep midwicket
nice delivery. Full, middle and leg, surprises Gambhir with no turn and quickness. Hits the pads, gets a dot
beaten in the flight as Swann tosses this up, but Gambhir manages to chip this over the infield on the off side
fullish, turning into the pads, helped away for one - just four off the over

Read this two or three times to believe this. Off the front foot, he has pulled a short-of-a-length delivery into the cow corner. He didn't even go back to create the pulling length. That's a shot and a half
steers this one down to third man for one
bouncer, hits him high on the bat as he pulls, but the ball doesn't go up, and he gets a single to deep square
slower full, too full, driven to long-on for one
digs it in short again, but it bounces only waist high, and he has pulled it to deep square on the bounce
charges down, yorks himself, but steers it to the right of third man, and comes back for two

how did that not bowl him? Missed stumping anyway. Beats Gambhir in the flight as this dips on him, and he falls over, and the ball squeezes between him and the leg stump. Kieswetter makes a mess of it
more lovely bowling. This is the quicker one, the toppie, outside off, and beats Kohli's drive

the pressure from Swann has finally drawn a false shot. Kohli gets too close to this delivery, and goes towards midwicket. Because he is so close to the pitch of the ball, he doesn't get the elevation, and picks out deep midwicket
flighted outside off, pushed to cover
full, nearly a yorker, driven to long-on

How did Aleem not give that? Flighted on off, doesn;t turn, goes with the arm, beats Gambhir who is playing across the line. Live time, that looked plumb. Aleem, though, doesn't raise his finger, and calls it a leg-bye too, which rules out an edge
short of a length, on off, dabbed away to third man
bouncer, 141ks, Sharma ducks under it
short of a length, angling in, pushed to midwicket, and they steal a single
slower ball, 110ks, short of a length, on the stumps, Gambhir reads it well, and runs it down to third man
pulled off the front foot, short at 135ks, and he gets it over midwicket even though the weight is coming forward all the time
short of a length, widish, punched away to deep cover
flighted, slow through the air, driven back to him
even slower, and gets it to dip on him, but Sharma lets it turn, and works it around the corner
angling into the pads, pushed into the leg side for one
length ball, turning in towards off, worked away to wide of Wright at deep square, Sharma wants two, but Gambhir is not turning back
flighted outside off, a half-volley really, driven to sweeper-cover

Morgan and Bairstow have made a mess of this. This is bunted into the leg side, between those two men who are converging on the ball. Neither of them collects it, though, and that gives India enough time to come back for the second
short of a length, outside of,f driven powerfully on the up, to the left of Fin n at sweeper-cover, who dives all over it
slower short ball, pulled away without control, but it doesn't carry to midwicket
shapes up to pull, but this ball stops at him, and he checks the shot to keep it down and take a single to midwicket
short, pulled away to deep midwicket on the bounce. He connected this well
short of a length, just outside off, dabbed to point
slower ball, short of a length, pitches leg, cuts away, Gambhir drops and runs, and gets the single easily
length ball on the pads with fine leg really square. Gambhir plays it fine, and gets four for it
dabs this wide of cover for one
that's a bit of a peach. Kicks off from short of a length, at 133ks, and beats Sharma's rather ambitious drive
short of a length again, Sharma moves across, works this into the leg side for one
slower bouncer, and Gambhir has mistimed it horrible, but has got it to land between the infield and the boundary riders
full, on off, pushed to long-on for one
Sharma opens up the front leg and lofts this absolutely straight. He hasn't timed it, but the straightness of the shot means it doesn't land in a fielder's lap
slower ball, pushed to long-on for one
lovely bouncer, 137ks, really sharp, between the shoulder and the head, and rising as it reached Kieswetter, who makes a one-handed overhead take
slower ball, Gambhir mis-hits the slog, and it lands safe between three men - midwicket, long-on and deep square

Finn has got his man. Gambhir has had a patchy innings, and finally one goes to hand. It;s the slower offcutter again, Gambhir looks to make room and go over extra cover, but all he manages is a healthy edge.The ball, though, is dying on Kieswetter, who dives forward to complete the catch
full, outside off, drilled, but straight to extra cover. Excellent over from Finn
length ball, into the pads, worked away, with soft hands, comes back for two
nice shot. Broad bowls the bouncer, following the backing-away Sharma, and he just opens the face to dink it over the keeper's head. Hold on, he closed his eyes as he played it
poor bowling. He has just brought the fine leg up, and he has bowled a short ball down leg side. Easily puled over that man
full and wide, Sharma is rooted on leg stump, and can't reach it with the drive
length ball, on off, slogged into the cow corner, Bairstow from long-on can't make the catch, but does well by pulling the ball back in even though it is over the rope but in the air. Saves one run

it's all happening. Broad beats Dhoni with the pace on a short delivery, and the ball lodges itself between his pad and his leg. Broad realises, though, that Sharma is running up, so he goes, collects the ball from its cosy resting place and tries to run Sharma out. Misses, though, and Sharma was gone by a long way had he hit. But I think the ball becomes dead as soon as it lodges itself there
slower ball right away, and Fin misfields at short fine to allow the second
full outside off, driven to third man for one
low full toss and wide, Dhoni gets enough bat on it, and places it to the left of sweeper-cover where Wright dives valiantly and in vain
slower legcutter, short of a length, on off, muscled away towards midwicket where Swann misfields to allow the second
wide of the crease, and bowls full and wide. Dhoni can't get under it, but drives it into the ground, and it bounces over Dernbach
slower ball again, dips alarmingly at him to york him. Concedes just the single towards long-off
Sharma moves well across, and disturbs a leg-side wide to lob it over short fine for a couple. It was a slower ball, which is why he couldn't time it
wide full toss, would have been another wide had Sharma not edged it away for four fine of third man
slower short ball, Sharma moves across to try to pull, but is beaten by the pace
full and wide, drilled to sweeper-cover for one
slower ball, short of a length, cutting in, cramping Dhoni up, who has bludgeoned this into his own toe. Precious dot
another dot. Oh, hold on, he has called this a wide. This is full and wide, but just inside that guide line for mine. Dhoni doesn't reach it, but it has been called a wide
yorker, but helicoptered away, Bresnan gets a hand to it, which takes pace off it, and that facilitates the second
wide length ball, Sharma can't reach it, called a wide
full toss, wide outside off, and he has sliced it for a six, the first of the innings. This ball has travelled all right. How well has he timed it. Didn't look like hitting it at all
slower ball, dipping on him, turning out to be a low full toss, and he has swept it between square leg and short fine leg. Sharma has reached fifty off 31. That will do him a world of good
slower legcutter, Sharma can't time it, gets a single to cover
wide - full and wide, but he has pushed it too wide

lovely tag-team work. Slower ball, Dhoni gets more height than distance, but this is still taking Butler with it over the long-on boundary. Butler catches it inches inside, knows he is going to step over with the momentum, and lobs it back in before doing so. And it turns out to be an easy catch for Hales, who has also run for the catch
Dernbach is having a horror time of time. Another wide, this time down the leg side
slower ball, dipping on him outside off, yorks him, concedes just the single
slower legcutter, short too, Sharma has to reach for it, and he chips it into the off side and gets a couple off the last ball
